trans-unit.source: The Savepoint interface contains methods to set, release, or roll back a transaction to designated savepoints. Once a savepoint has been set, the transaction can be rolled back to that savepoint without affecting preceding work. Savepoints provide finer-grained control of transactions by marking intermediate points within a transaction.

seg-source.mrk: The Savepoint interface contains methods to set, release, or roll back a transaction to designated savepoints.
Once a savepoint has been set, the transaction can be rolled back to that savepoint without affecting preceding work.
Savepoints provide finer-grained control of transactions by marking intermediate points within a transaction.

target.mrk: The Savepoint interface contains methods to set, release, or roll back a transaction to designated savepoints.
Once a savepoint has been set, the transaction can be rolled back to that savepoint without affecting preceding work.
Savepoints provide finer-grained control of transactions by marking intermediate points within a transaction.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support savepoints within a trigger.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support savepoints within a trigger.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not release locks as part of the rollback to savepoint.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not release locks as part of the rollback to savepoint.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not release locks as part of the rollback to savepoint.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using savepoints, see the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
